net.jbasics.util

Class AssertThat

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jbasics.util.AssertThat

  • public final class AssertThat
extends Object

    Assertion utility class that assists in validating arguments and other values at runtime.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    2020-01-28
    Author:
    Rob Stoecklein

      • valueIsAnId

        public static void valueIsAnId(Object varValue,
                               String varName)
        Assert that an object is a valid database identifier, which is a non-zero positive integer.

        A valid identifier is:

        • not null
        • of type Integer, Long, or String
        • has a numeric value greater than or equal to one 
            AssertThat.valueIsAnId(null, "varName") = false    // null
    AssertThat.valueIsAnId(0, "varName")    = false    // zero
    AssertThat.valueIsAnId(-45, "varName")  = false    // negative
    AssertThat.valueIsAnId(6.3, "varName")  = false    // wrong type (double)
    AssertThat.valueIsAnId("", "varName")   = false    // empty string
    AssertThat.valueIsAnId(23, "varName")   = true     // integer
    AssertThat.valueIsAnId(67L, "varName")  = true     // long
    AssertThat.valueIsAnId("89", "varName") = true     // string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - -
        Since:
        1.0

            AssertThat.stringIsDate("04/07/2021");    // throws Exception
    AssertThat.stringIsDate("2021-07-04");    // okay

      • date

        public static void date(LocalDate date1,
                        String operator,
                        LocalDate date2)
        Assert that two dates have the desired relationship to each other.

        An exception is thrown in the following conditions:

        • if either input date is null
        • if the operator is null or invalid
        • if the comparison operation fails
        Parameters:
        date1 - local date, throws exception if null
        operator - one of: [EQ, NE, LT, LE, GT, GE], or alternatively: [==, !=, <, <=, >, >=]
        date2 - local date, throws exception if null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - -

      • number

        public static void number(Number number1,
                          String operator,
                          Number number2)
        Assert that two numbers have the desired relationship to each other.

        An exception is thrown in the following conditions:

        • if either input number is null
        • if the operator is null or invalid
        • number1 and number2 are not of the same general type, i.e., either an integer type (byte, short, int, long, BigInteger), or a floating point type (float, double, BigDecial)
        • if the comparison operation fails
        Parameters:
        number1 - fails if null
        operator - one of: [EQ, NE, LT, LE, GT, GE], or alternatively: [==, !=, <, <=, >, >=]
        number2 - fails if null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - -

      • string

        public static void string(String string1,
                          String operator,
                          String string2)
        Assert that two strings have the desired relationship to each other.

        An exception is thrown in the following conditions:

        • if either input string is null
        • if the operator is null or invalid
        • if the comparison operation fails
        Parameters:
        string1 - fails if null
        operator - one of: [EQ, NE, LT, LE, GT, GE], or alternatively: [==, !=, <, <=, >, >=]
        string2 - fails if null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - -

      • valueFitsIntoByte

        public static void valueFitsIntoByte(long longValue)
        Assert that the given long would fit into a byte variable without overflowing it. 
            AssertThat.valueFitsIntoByte(0)                  = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoByte(Byte.MAX_VALUE)     = true     // 0x7f = +127 = +(2**7) - 1
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoByte(Byte.MIN_VALUE)     = true     // 0x80 = -128 = -(2**7)
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoByte(Byte.MAX_VALUE + 1) = false
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoByte(Byte.MIN_VALUE - 1) = false
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - -
        Since:
        1.0

      • valueFitsIntoChar

        public static void valueFitsIntoChar(long longValue)
        Assert that the given long would fit into a char variable without overflowing it. 
            AssertThat.valueFitsIntoChar(0)       = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoChar(0xffff)  = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoChar(-1)      = false
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoChar(0x10000) = false
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - -
        Since:
        1.0

      • valueFitsIntoShort

        public static void valueFitsIntoShort(long longValue)
        Assert that the given long would fit into a short variable without overflowing it. 
            AssertThat.valueFitsIntoShort(0)                   = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoShort(Short.MAX_VALUE)     = true   // 0x7fff = +32_767 = +(2**15) - 1
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoShort(Short.MIN_VALUE)     = true   // 0x8000 = -32_768 = -(2**15)
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoShort(Short.MAX_VALUE + 1) = false
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoShort(Short.MIN_VALUE - 1) = false
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - -
        Since:
        1.0

      • valueFitsIntoInteger

        public static void valueFitsIntoInteger(long longValue)
        Assert that the given long would fit into an int variable without overflowing it. 
            AssertThat.valueFitsIntoInteger(0)                     = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoInteger(Integer.MAX_VALUE)     = true   // 0x7fffffff = +2_147_483_647 = +(2**31) - 1
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoInteger(Integer.MIN_VALUE)     = true   // 0x80000000 = -2_147_483_648 = -(2**31)
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoInteger(Integer.MAX_VALUE + 1) = false
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoInteger(Integer.MIN_VALUE - 1) = false
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - -
        Since:
        1.0

      • valueFitsIntoLong

        public static void valueFitsIntoLong(double doubleValue)
        Assert that the given double would fit into a long variable without overflowing it.

        Note: A long value has more significant digits than a double, therefore some of the lower-order bits can be lost. In other words, in cases with very large numbers, the resolution is reduced, however the magnitude is not (otherwise an exception is thrown). 

            AssertThat.valueFitsIntoLong(0)                      = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoLong((double)Long.MAX_VALUE) = true    // 0x7fffffffffffffff = +9_223_372_036_854_775_807 = +(2**63) - 1
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoLong((double)Long.MIN_VALUE) = true    // 0x8000000000000000 = -9_223_372_036_854_775_808 = -(2**63)
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoLong((double)Long.MAX_VALUE + 10_000) = false
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoLong((double)Long.MIN_VALUE - 10_000) = false
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - -
        Since:
        1.0

      • valueFitsIntoFloat

        public static void valueFitsIntoFloat(double doubleValue)
        Assert that the given double would fit into a float variable without overflowing it.

        Like the valueFitsIntoLong() method, resolution reduction is not checked, but a change in magnitude throws an exception. 

            AssertThat.valueFitsIntoFloat(0.0)                    = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoFloat(Float.MAX_VALUE)        = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoFloat(Float.MIN_VALUE)        = true
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoFloat(Float.MAX_VALUE * 1.01) = false
    AssertThat.valueFitsIntoFloat(Float.MIN_VALUE * 1.01) = true
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - -
        Since:
        1.0

      • valueIsInArray

        public static void valueIsInArray(Object varValue,
                                  Object[] validArray,
                                  String varName)
        Checks to see if the value exists in the given array of valid values. 
            AssertThat.valueIsInArray("name", "abc", ["abc", "xyz"]);
    AssertThat.valueIsInArray("name", "xyz", ["abc", "xyz"]);
    AssertThat.valueIsInArray("name", "foo", ["abc", "xyz"]);  // throws IllegalValueException
        Parameters:
        varValue - value to test
        validArray - array of valid values
        varName - name of the variable, used when exception thrown
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the varValue does not exist in the validArray
        Since:
        1.0

      • valueIsInList

        public static void valueIsInList(Object varValue,
                                 List<?> validList,
                                 String varName)
        Checks to see if the value exists in the given list of valid values. 
            AssertThat.valueIsInList("name", "abc", (List)["abc", "xyz"]);
    AssertThat.valueIsInList("name", "xyz", (List)["abc", "xyz"]);
    AssertThat.valueIsInList("name", "foo", (List)["abc", "xyz"]);  // throws IllegalValueException
        Parameters:
        varValue - value to test
        validList - list of valid values
        varName - name of the variable, used when exception thrown
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the varValue does not exist in the validList
        Since:
        1.0

      • objectIsInstanceOf

        public static void objectIsInstanceOf(Object object,
                                      Class<?> type)
        Assert that the subType can be type cast to the superType. 
            final Double doubleObject = 8.9;
    AssertThat.objectIsInstanceOf(doubleObject.getClass(), Number.class);  // does not throw exception
    final Number numberObject = doubleObject;                        // which means this assignment is fine
    AssertThat.objectIsInstanceOf(doubleObject.getClass(), Map.class);     // throws exception
        Parameters:
        object - the object to check
        type - the type to check against
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object is not an instance of the type
        Since:
        1.0
